extendedIngredients.name: red belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 4 heads white or red Belgian endive (4 to 5 oz. each)
extendedIngredients.originalName: heads white or red Belgian endive each)

extendedIngredients.name: swiss cheese
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 cup shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese (3 oz.)
extendedIngredients.originalName: 3/4 cup shredded Gruyère or Swiss cheese

title: Braised Belgian Endive au Gratin
summary: Braised Belgian Endive au Gratin is a vegetarian side dish. For $1.45 per serving, this recipe covers 8% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 191 calories, 8g of protein, and 14g of fat. This recipe serves 4. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. If you have olive oil, belgian endive, ground nutmeg, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 28%. This score is not so awesome. Similar recipes include Gratin of Belgian Endive with Bacon (Gratin d'Endives Ardennaise), Belgian Endive Ham Au Gratin, and Braised Belgian Endive.
instructions: Rinse Belgian endive; trim off any discolored bases. Cut heads in half lengthwise. Arrange the halves, cut side down, in a single layer in a heavy 11- to 12-inch frying pan. Add 1/4 cup water and the olive oil. Sprinkle endive lightly with salt and pepper. Cover pan and bring to boil over high heat, then reduce heat and simmer until endive is very tender when pierced, 12 to 20 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat, turning heads occasionally, until liquid is evaporated and endive is slightly browned, 6 to 10 minutes.                                                                                                 Meanwhile, in a 1- to 2-quart pan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until blended and bubbly. Add milk and nutmeg; stir until mixture is boiling and thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste.                                                                                                 Arrange endive in a single layer in a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Spoon sauce over the top. Sprinkle evenly with remaining 1/4 cup cheese.                                                                                                 Bake, uncovered, in a 400 oven until sauce is bubbling and lightly browned, 9 to 14 minutes. Add more salt and pepper to taste.

steps.step: Rinse Belgian endive; trim off any discolored bases.
Cut heads in half lengthwise. Arrange the halves, cut side down, in a single layer in a heavy 11- to 12-inch frying pan.
Add 1/4 cup water and the olive oil.

Sprinkle endive lightly with salt and pepper. Cover pan and bring to boil over high heat, then reduce heat and simmer until endive is very tender when pierced, 12 to 20 minutes. Uncover and cook over medium heat, turning heads occasionally, until liquid is evaporated and endive is slightly browned, 6 to 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a 1- to 2-quart pan over medium-low heat, melt butter. Stir in flour until blended and bubbly.
Add milk and nutmeg; stir until mixture is boiling and thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup cheese.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange endive in a single layer in a shallow 2-quart baking dish. Spoon sauce over the top.
Sprinkle evenly with remaining 1/4 cup cheese.
Bake, uncovered, in a 400 oven until sauce is bubbling and lightly browned, 9 to 14 minutes.
Add more salt and pepper to taste.
